enum.int: HTTP credentials were moved during migration to HTTPS
HTTP credentials were copied during migration to HTTPS

int.label: Only values from JavaScript, and no user focus
Only values from JavaScript, and user focus
Encryption is available but invalid entries exist in the database
Should not delete, user data directory is specified using the enviroment variable
Should not delete, user data directory is specified via switch
Should not delete, password store is specified via switch
Should not delete, encryption selection is specified via switch
Should not delete, encryption is not availiable

enum.name: LoginsChangedTrigger
enum.summary: Triggers that may indirectly cause PasswordStore observers notifications because logins *may* have changed.
enum.int: Chrome either was notified about external changes (e.g. via subscription notification) or started a new foregrounding session and needs to refresh data that may have changed due to external credential management.
A credential was saved by Chrome. Update observers with all credentials because the addition may conflict with an existing credential.

A credential was updated by Chrome. Update observers with all credentials because updates may have caused implicit removals (e.g. due to primary key changes) or the update may have failed (e.g. because of a prior deletion).
A single credential was removed by Chrome. Update observers with all credentials because removal might fail (i.e. credential was already gone).
Multiple credentials where removed by Chrome. Update observers with all credentials because removals might fail.
Chrome removed blocklisting entries. Update observers with all credentials to confirm the remaining saving exceptions.

Opened manually / Offering to add an username to the saved password

Opened automatically / Notifying the user that their passkey was saved
Opened automatically / Notifying the user that their passkey was deleted because it was not present on an unknown credential report and that they need to log in to create a new passkey
Opened manually / Notifying the user that their passkey was deleted because it was not present on an unknown credential report and that they need to log in to create a new passkey
Opened automatically / Notifying the user that their passkey details have been updated.
Opened manually / Notifying the user that their passkey details have been updated.

enum.name: PasswordManager.MoveToAccountStoreTrigger
enum.summary: Triggers that will cause Chrome to offer to move a password from the profile store to the account store.
enum.int: The user successfully logged in with a password from the profile store. Recorded only on Win/Mac/Linux.
The user explicitly asked to move a password listed in Settings. Recorded on iOS/Win/Mac/Linux.
The user explicitly asked to move multiple passwords at once in Settings. Recorded only on Win/Mac/Linux.
After saving a password locally, the user opted in to saving this and future passwords in the account. Recorded only on Win/Mac/Linux.
The user explicitly asked to move a password to account store from password details page.
The user clicked a link in a footer of the manage passwords bubble.

enum.name: PasswordManagerFillingAssistance

int.label: :-) Credential fields filled manually (but none required typing)
:-| Password filled (automatically or manually), known username was typed
:-X Unknown password typed, some saved credentials existed
:-X Unknown password typed, no saved credentials existed

enum.int: For example, it might be because of 3rd party password managers.

int.label: :-X Unknown password typed, no saved credentials existed and site was explicitly blocklisted
:-X Unknown password typed, no saved credentials existed and site is blocklisted by the smart bubble
:-) User used manual fallback to fill the form
Typed manually (i.e. filled from neither the account-scoped nor the profile-scoped store
Filled from both in the profile-scoped and the account-scoped store

enum.name: PasswordManagerFirstRendererFillingResult
enum.int: The password element to be filled has not been found.
Filling only happens in iframes if all parent frames PSL-match the security origin of the iframe containing the password field.
Passwords are not filled into fields that are not editable.
The username field contains a string that does not match the username of any available credential. This typically indicates placeholder values.

No credential was filled due to mismatches with the username. This can happen in a number of cases: In case the username field is empty and readonly. In case of a username-first-flow where a user's credentials do contain a username but the form contains only a password field and no username field. In case of change password forms that contain no username field. In case the user name is given on a page but only PSL matched credentials exist for this username. There may be further cases.

Renderer was instructed to wait until user has manually picked a credential. This happens for example if the session is an incognito session, the credendial's URL matches the mainframe only via the PSL, the site is on HTTP, or the form has no current password field. PasswordManager.FirstWaitForUsernameReason records the root causes.
No fillable elements were found, only possible for the old form parser.

enum.name: PasswordManagerFirstWaitForUsernameReason
enum.int: User is browsing in incognito mode.
A credential exists for a PSL matched site but not for the current security origin.
Form is suspected to be a password change form. (Only recorded for old form parser)
User is on a site with an insecure main frame origin.
User is browsing with the Touch To Fill feature enabled.
User is browsing with the Fill On Select feature enabled.
Re-authenticaion for filling passwords is required.
Password field is already filled in and it doesn't look like a placeholder.
A credential exists for an affiliated matched site but not for the current security origin.
The form acccepts WebAuthn credentials from an active WebAuthn request.
User needs to reauthenticate using biometric.
The form is in a cross origin iframe.

enum.name: PasswordManagerHttpCredentialType
enum.summary: This enum records the type of a given HTTP credential. Depending on its username and the password, an HTTP credential can have no matching, an equivalent or a conflicting HTTPS credentials. Also the corresponding website can be served with or without HSTS enabled.

int.label: Chosen file exceeds max file size
Conflicts need to be resolved by the user.

enum.name: PasswordManagerMatchedFormType
enum.int: A credential exists for a PSL matched site but not for the current security origin.
A credential exists for an affiliated android app but not for the current security origin. This is provided as a credential sharing affiliation by AffiliationService.
A credential exists for an affiliated site but not for the current security origin. This is provided as a credential sharing affiliation by AffiliationService.
A credential exists for another entity, which is grouped with the current domain by the AffiliationService through a grouping affiliation.
A credential exists for an android application, which is grouped with the current domain by the AffiliationService through a grouping affiliation.
A credential exists for a website, which is grouped with the current domain by the AffiliationService through a grouping affiliation.

int.label: User clicked Add shortcut from the UI.
User switched profile in the standalone password manager app.

int.label: Import dialog opened from the three-dot menu.
Import dialog opened from the empty passwords list.
Import flow canceled before the file selection.
UPM: View passwords clicked after successful import.
API was called without a context.
API was called without an account.
GMS Core version is not supported.
API was successfully called, but returned an error.
API was successfully called, but result is unknown.
Failed to create FacetId to obtain affiliated matches.
Job cancelled because the sync state changed
Generated password overridden by a non-generated one
Reading success but metadata cleaned for initial sync
Reading success but metadata cleaned to resolve inconsistencies in the cache of unsupported proto fields

Reading successful, but the browser has just been upgraded to a version that supports passwords notes. Therefore, the metadata are cleared to enforce the initial sync flow and download any potential passwords notes on the server
Reading successful, but suspicious bulk deletions were detected. To err on the side of safety, drop all password sync metadata and start again.
Credential row is clicked to open password view page
The user opens the password view page to view an existing credential.
The user opens the password view page to view an non-existing credential
Credential username, password or note edited
The password view page authentication timed out while the edit dialog is open
The password view page authentication timed out while the edit dialog is closed
The credential is requested by typing the URL.
Passkey copy display name button clicked

enum.name: PrefilledUsernameFillOutcome
enum.int: 1) the page has a username input element whose value was prefilled by the website itself. 2) the prefilled value was found in a list of known placeholder values (e.g. "username or email"). 3) the user had a credential stored and the field content was overridden with the username of this credential due to 2).

1) the page has a username input element whose value was prefilled by the website itself. 2) the prefilled value was NOT found in a list of known placeholder values (e.g. "username or email"). 3) the user had a credential stored and the field content was NOT overridden with the username of this credential due to 2).

enum.summary: Reason why a provisional save failed.
